Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' videos show flights endangered by various forces of nature, and raise questions about how prepared we really are to fly against the elements.

Clip.Title: CIVIL WAR 360
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Take a journey back in time and immerse yourself in a 150-year-old battle that nearly split our nation in two. This three-part series explores famous and little known aspects of the Civil War, from the perspectives of the Union, the Confederacy and the millions of enslaved people struggling for freedom. Hosted by Ashley Judd, Trace Adkins, and Dennis Haysbert, all of whom had ancestors greatly affected by the war, this series delivers fresh insights and untold tales, brought to life through dramatic recreations and the Smithsonian Institution's vast collection of artifacts.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: TERROR IN THE SKIES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Passengers' videos show flights endangered by various forces of nature, and raise questions about how prepared we really are to fly against the elements.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

This three-part series explores famous and little known aspects of the Civil War, from the perspectives of the Union, the Confederacy and the millions of enslaved people struggling for freedom. Hosted by Ashley Judd, Trace Adkins, and Dennis Haysbert, all of whom had ancestors greatly affected by the war, this series delivers fresh insights and untold tales, brought to life through dramatic recreations and the Smithsonian Institution's vast collection of artifacts.

Clip.Title: ALL ABOARD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Trek across the vast plains of China on the cramped but culturally diverse train line.

Clip.Title: RIVERS OF THE WORLD
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Learn why the ancestral river of the Incas is so essential to the survival of the nearby villages. And why they are all in danger.

Clip.Title: ARABIA UNCOVERED
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover Saudi Arabia's fascinating past, captured in over 200 artifacts. Each item reveals stories of the migrants, traders, and pilgrims who have been drawn to this land for centuries.

Clip.Title: SKY VIEW
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Soar over Europe and experience the landscape from an eagle's perspective. This remarkable series uses the latest HD and camera mount technology to give the audience a view of Europe and its history that will takes their breath away.

Clip.Title: THE HISTORY OF THE FUTURE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Find out why some inquiring minds believe that the world is headed for ruin within the next century.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Tecumseh forges an alliance with the British in pursuit of his dream of a unified First Nations.

Clip.Title: CANADA 1812: FORGED IN FIRE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Half Cherokee and half Scottish, John Norton leads Six Nations warriors against the invading Americans.

Clip.Title: THE SILK ROAD
Clip.Episode: From Wasteland to Motherland: Central Asia
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Journey through Central Asia, Russia and the Ukraine, and listen to the songs and stories of people who are longing to return to the homelands of their distant memories.

Clip.Title: THE NORTH POLE CONSPIRACY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Who was the first man to reach the North Pole? Join the in-depth investigation into one of the great historical controversies of the 20th Century.

Clip.Title: LINCOLN'S WASHINGTON AT WAR
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Washington, D.C. in 1861. The Civil War is at the doorstep and the city is bracing for disaster. America is a country torn in two. An untested President Lincoln strives to make the nation's capital the political center of the Union, but finds he is surrounded by Southern sympathies and under constant threat of attack.

Clip.Title: THE SILK ROAD
Clip.Episode: From Wasteland to Motherland: Central Asia
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Journey through Central Asia, Russia and the Ukraine, and listen to the songs and stories of people who are longing to return to the homelands of their distant memories.
